settings.heading: A Uniform That Supports Women’s Health And Perinatal Care.
settings.body:
Boodjari Moort supports Indigenous women in achieving safe and positive health outcomes for themselves, their pregnancies, and their children. 

The team at Boodjari Moort consists of 13 dedicated staff, both Indigenous and non-Indigenous, each with their own strong connections with their communities and the women they service. This means their level of Cultural sensitivity and community care is paramount to creating a strong team which enables positive health outcomes.

settings.text:
Background

Boodjari Moort sought a uniform that would create a strong sense of unity among their team while ensuring they were easily recognisable within the community. They envisioned a design that not only reflected their commitment to culturally inclusive healthcare but also celebrated Aboriginal culture. The result was a practical and meaningful uniform that fosters pride and connection for both the team and the community they support.

First featured at their participation in the 2024 Vestrum Women’s Fun Run & Walk, the bright and contemporary pinks of Bunuba and Gija artist Eulalia Martin’s Tribe of Women design separated the team from the crowd and prompted conversations about the importance of women’s health. 

“Such a great conversation starter, it really makes you feel like you belong in this team. Everyone asked, “Where can I get one?””
settings.text_2:
Services 

  • Uniform Redesign
  • Express Local Production 
  • Branding

With a fast turnaround for fundraising success, Boodari Moort was able to receive their uniforms in under 2 weeks without compromising on quality. Utilising our Express Local production service, they were able to receive their custom-designed uniforms to perfectly align their event schedule.

settings.heading: Custom Branding Design
settings.body:
Opting to select the Tribe of Women design, Boodjari Moort was proud to represent their passion for care through strong community bonds. 

“We are a multicultural and multidisciplinary family…, we are so passionate about providing Culturally safe care and advocacy for our mob, … [to] grow health families and feel confident.” 

Highlighting the importance of taking on the “village” role in perinatal care, Boodjari Moort emphasises how Tribe of Women signifies the collective efforts to support mothers, babies, and families during these crucial journeys.

settings.heading: Advice for Uniform Refresh
settings.body:
The team at Boodjari Moort gave us their best advice for any teams considering refreshing their uniforms. With a strong community focus, they believe keeping this in mind is how to get it right:

  • Opt for your usual size, but if you are unsure, ask! Our Yarn Corporate team of experts is more than willing to help resolve any sizing concerns. 
  • If the values of your workplace and community are captured in a certain artwork or story, don't hesitate to spark those conversations in uniform options. 
  • Listen to your team and your community, and take on their responses and feedback.
